simply is not an honest, principled animal by
nature. As long as limited material rewards
are to be fought for, men will cheat and steal
to attain these rewards. Man is compelled to
be honest not by conscience but by fear of
punishment. A system minus such a threat

nature. As long as limited material rewards
are to be fought for, men will cheat and steal
to attain these rewards. Man is compelled to
be honest not by conscience but by fear of
punishment. A system minus such a threat

Do the Costs of Football
Preclude Its Continuance?
By JAY LENROW
By now almost everyone at Hopkins is
aware of the fact that following the Western
Maryland football game on Saturday,
November 21, Coach Alex Sotir resigned.
Coach Sotir has listed his reasons for
resigning as "personal." Yet it is no secret
that he was disappointed by the turnout at
recent football games.
Football as a sport has become
increasingly more professional in outlook in
many of the larger colleges in the country.
Sports Illustrated of February 1, 1971,
devotes space to this phenomena. They cite
the fact that forty-two colleges have dropped
intercollegiate football in the last ten years.
While general price rises have been in the
neighborhood of 5% a year, the most recent
National Collegiate Athletic Association
study puts average football expense
increases at 19% between 1968 and 1969.
The average football player is wearing
almost $200 worth of equipment when he sets
foot on the field on Saturdays. This does not
include such things as game jerseys and
training table expenses.
It is the unfortunate result that football has
lost some of the element of sport for sports
sake and has become a drill sport. It is
impossible today to take a group of boys and
turn them into a football team of any calibre
without drilling.
Sports like soccer and lacrosse work on
some fundamentals but can be practiced
effectively by scrimmaging. Football has
become so specialized that it requires six
coaches, even at a small school like Hopkins.
One must have an offensive line coach, a
defensive line coach, offensive backfield
coach, a defensive backfield coach, a
spotter, a head coach, and someone to scout
